Package ui.menu.button

Class ExitButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.drawing.DrawableSection
      • ui.input.selection.DrawableSelectableSection
        • ui.menu.button.Button
          • ui.menu.button.ExitButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrintHandler, Section, SelectableSection, SelectionHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExitButton
    public class ExitButton
extends Button
    A button that exits the program. This is done by setting the exit property of the TerminalHandler to true.
    Represents a selectable button.
    Represents a selectable section that can be drawn to the terminal window.
    Represents a section that can be drawn to the terminal window.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExitButton

        public ExitButton​(TerminalHandler handler,
                  java.lang.String text,
                  Colour textColour,
                  Colour bracketColour,
                  BackgroundColour unfocusedColour,
                  BackgroundColour focusedColour,
                  boolean enabled)
        Constructor for ExitButton.
        Parameters:
        handler - The TerminalHandler.
        text - The button text.
        textColour - The button text colour.
        bracketColour - The colour of the brackets that indicate this is a button.
        unfocusedColour - The background colour when unfocused.
        focusedColour - The background colour when focused.
        enabled - Boolean; true if button is enabled for selection.

    • Method Detail

      • select

        public KeyHandler select​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when the user selects this element. In this case, exit the program.
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (could be a different key handler for e.g. entering text).
